snippet.title: Classic Games - AMIGA - UGH! (first 20 levels, 720p)
snippet.description:
Gameplay starts at 3:36
Info:
1-2 Players (Co-op)
Programmed by Thomas Klinger, Björn Roy
Graphics by Thomas Klinger
Level Design Peter Schmitz, Björn Roy
Music by Rudolf Stember
Audio FX by Björn's voice
Developed by EGO Software 1992 (now famous for the X game series)
Published by Play Byte (Blue Byte)
Released for AMIGA 500 (OCS, ECS hardware), 1 Disk

Recorded without video/audio filters, using original AMIGA 500 4-channel stereo sound.
Original recording 50 FPS, converted to 30 FPS for youtube.


UGH! [...] "features a caveman who, in order to appeal to his beloved future mate, controls a stone-age muscle-powered helicopter, picking up passengers and flying them to the desired location for money. The player must venture through 69 levels, and must evade natural obstacles as well as hostile Dinosaurs and "Birds" (actually pterosaurs). Collisions with obstacles and hard landings inflict damage to the helicopter. Also, powering the helicopter exhausts the pilot, which may be recovered by picking up fruits knocked off Tree with Stone. Stone may be also dropped on a hostile monster, knocking it out for a short time." (source: wikipedia)
